When it comes to IT businesses want the same things.
They want it to be easy to manage. They want it to help them. The want it to give energy rather than take it away.

We specialise in three things to get your IT to a better place:

Turning chaos into order - systems can run away with themselves - we are experts at unravelling the mess

Integrating anything with everything - with more applications on more devices than every getting everything to play nice is essential

Facilitating rapid expansion - all our IT systems can seamlessly adapted to client success

Moving Brands

chaos to order

Moving Brands need to focus on their creative output, not worrying about making their IT work.

We did two things.

We standardised all devices. The new reliable set-up is managed centrally, but flexible enough to give teams access to any tool or device they needed without risking security.

We did a review of the infrastructure and actioned the follwing:

  • re-design of San Francisco office IT
  • single switch stack to solve inefficient and overly complex network infrastructure
  • disaster-proof backup upgrade
  • storage and directory services simplification
  • true network optimisation: better and faster connection between offices
  • immediate software expansion - push secure and customisable software changes done simultaneously
  • cloud-based advantages - giving scalability, speed and cost savings

BRIT School

integration

The school grows every year and hungrily embraces new technologies. With lots of new devices and systems available the in-house IT team struggled integrating new tech into old systems.

The school was introduced to pebble by Apple.

We performed a network infrastructure technical audit, network analysis and reviewed suitability of all hardware

Then we:

  • consolidated server room layout
  • created a disaster recover plan
  • took over mac technical support
  • implemented remotely managed mobile device management

This gave the school

  • faster and more reliable infrastructure,
  • significant reduction in technical problems
  • simplification of trouble shooting,
  • stable network storage - improving reliability;
  • remote and instantaneous software updates for whole school,
  • Cost savings because device management was inexpensive and future-proof;
  • time saving for school's IT staff

forpeople

rapid expansion

forpeople used to use ad-hoc IT support, which makes sense when you start out but if you grow rapidly and donâ€™t have a robust technical strategy in place problems start to appear.

So we performed an audit of the existing infrastructure, got a deep understanding of the working practices to write our proposal

  • Technical support & help desk
  • Managed Mac platform
  • Re-imaging & deployment capability
  • Introduce volume licensing
  • Managed wireless access points
  • Migrate to Google Apps for Business
  • Introduce FTP solution
  • Built a Render Farm

What can the client do now that they couldn't do before?

  • Manage Mac & PCs together
  • Quickly add or remove software
  • Quickly deploy new machines
  • security & policy control across devices
  • New in-house processes with archiving & new starter forms
  • Enabled faster, more productive creative work.
